story_arc: promise → course → data-staircase → pro/con → verdict → alternatives

primary_trope.name: tier_reveal
primary_trope.hook_text: 328 races. 14 dimensions. Where does Parker Dam Gravel Grinder land?
primary_trope.mechanism: Countdown / ranking — inherent escalation and social comparison.

beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Parker Dam Gravel Grinder? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Parker Dam Gravel Grinder scored 40 out of 100. Grassroots tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.text_on_screen: Should You Race Parker Dam Gravel Grinder?

broll_sources.query: Parker Dam Gravel Grinder gravel race

beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Parker Dam Gravel Grinder. Clearfield County, Pennsylvania. 50 mi. Pennsylvania rolling gravel.
beats.text_on_screen: Parker Dam Gravel Grinder | Clearfield County, Pennsylvania | 50 mi

broll_sources.query: Parker Dam Gravel Grinder route map
Parker Dam Gravel Grinder course walkthrough

beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Time to break down the scorecard. Value. 4 out of 5. Strong value proposition. Registration includes shirt, chip timing, post-race meal, aid stations, and awards - solid package for what's likely modest entry fees. Expenses. 3 out of 5. Standard gravel race budget. Logistics. 2 out of 5. You'll figure it out. Eventually. Length. 2 out of 5. Won't destroy your week. The 52-mile half series sits in comfortable middle ground territory. Technicality. 2 out of 5. Mild technical demands. Pick decent tires. Course described as "relatively flat course for this part of the world" by Pennsylvania standards, mixing gravel roads with paved sections. Elevation. 2 out of 5. Rolling terrain. Nothing that'll break you. 3,500 feet over 50 miles means steady climbing without massive punches - 70 feet per mile average. Climate. 2 out of 5. Weather cooperates more often than not. May 9th date in Pennsylvania means spring weather variability - could be 45 and rainy or 75 and perfect. Adventure. 2 out of 5. Light adventure. Nothing wild. Rural Pennsylvania gravel roads through state park lands offer decent scenery without epic wilderness.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: The remaining six. Quick-fire. Race Quality. 2 out of 5. Adequate. Room for improvement. Experience. 2 out of 5. A nice day on the bike. Nothing more. Community. 2 out of 5. Some community spirit. Nothing organized. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Low altitude. Breathe easy. Prestige. 1 out of 5. Under the radar. Completely unknown. Field Depth. 1 out of 5. Small field. You might podium by showing up.
beats.editing_note: FAST PACING — 7 seconds per dimension. Quick-fire energy change from the deep analysis above. This is a PATTERN INTERRUPT through pacing shift.

beats.editing_note: Warm energy. Each strength gets its own card. Avatar genuinely positive.

beats.label: WEAKNESSES
beats.visual: Weaknesses list with warning visual treatment
beats.editing_note: MIDPOINT RE-ENGAGEMENT. This is ~55% through. Open with burst sequence (quick cuts, warning sounds). Then deliver weaknesses honestly. Preview what's coming: 'Now, should you actually do this race?' [RIFF HERE] at the transition.

beats.label: LOGISTICS
beats.narration: The logistics. What you actually need to know.

broll_sources.query: Parker Dam Gravel Grinder race day

beats.editing_note: Utility section. Lower energy, practical value. Hybrid Tempo: alternate fast logistics items (10-15 sec) with slow map visuals (30 sec).

logistics: Lodging: Clearfield County has limited lodging options. Plan ahead.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: Pennsylvania Local Gravel. If you're local to Pennsylvania. yes, it's good value. If you're traveling. skip it.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If Parker Dam Gravel Grinder isn't quite right for you. For better Pennsylvania races: Dirty Kanza PA, Trans-Sylvania Epic.
beats.editing_note: Bonus value — viewers who reach this point are highly engaged. Cross-reference other videos/races.

beats.label: CTA
beats.narration: Full breakdown on the site. Fourteen scored dimensions. Free race prep kit. Link in the description.
beats.editing_note: End ABRUPTLY after CTA. No 'thanks for watching' wind-down.
beats.engagement_question: Have you raced Parker Dam Gravel Grinder? Did we get the score right? Drop it in the comments.

meme_inserts.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

thumbnail_prompt: South Park style flat cutout character, dramatic reveal pose, tier badge prominent, 'Parker Dam Gravel Grinder' bold text, tier badge 'GRASSROOTS', high contrast red/yellow/white, cycling gear, handlebar mustache --ar 16:9 --cref [CHARACTER_URL]

cross_platform_notes.blog: Cross-reference the race profile page for search traffic.
